segmentosSRT.text:
The strange thing was that I didn’t
notice her as worried as I was.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
If I wake up mute I would
probably go crazy.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
I noticed it was an attitude
that she was assuming.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
I could never knew if was just
in front of me or everyone
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: or facing life.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: Maybe she was punishing us all.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: But then she stopped speaking.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
I don’t think she can’t speak,
I think that she has decided not to speak.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: And I think it’s a voluntary decision.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
I thought, however, that it
could be a medical issue.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: We took her to the doctor
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
I talked to Héctor, to César 
and to other people.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: To everyone I thought could know.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
They all came to the
same conclusion:
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
Aracelly's problem
is inexplicable.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
It’s not physiological, and it
doesn’t seem psychological either.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
Always, always, always, I think
that she always understands us.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
She hasn't lost the
capacity of understanding
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
nor has she lost any
other kind of routines.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: She reads, she walks, she thinks,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: she insinuates, she takes initiatives.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: I think that she is taking somehow revenge.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
And I think that, somehow, what she’s pretending
is to make life unbearable to everyone.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
If that’s the case, she
should have said it,
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: and it would have been better
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
that we would just
have ended everything.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: I think that families begin
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
and families dissolve, families
should not self-destruct.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text: I think we never talked enough about love.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
Because if we had talked
enough about love
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
we would have understood
it from the beginning.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
Love is born, it grows and it
dies like everything in nature.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
I believe that the academic attitude is not
only repeating texts in the universities
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08

segmentosSRT.text:
but to live academically,
and that we have lacked.
segmentosSRT.speaker: SPEAKER_08
